title: Ships of Discovery
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 2,344 words, Level Y (Grade 5), Lexile 980L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     T and W		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     T and W
description: Ships of Discovery is an informational book about the types of boats that explorers built and used when discovering new lands. Ships and conquests of Polynesian, Viking, European, and Chinese explorers are explained. The author also describes the people who set out to sea as well as their motivations for going. Illustrations and maps support the text.
meta: archipelago, bountiful, buoyant, caravels, catamaran, clipper ships, commerce, eliminated, habitable, indigenous, ingenuity, knarrs, scurvy, speculated, streamlined, tiers, triremes
Use the reading strategy of summarizing to understand nonfiction text
Compare and Contrast : Identify details to compare and contrast ships
Adjectives : Identify adjectives and the nouns they describe
Compound Words : Identify and create compound words

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
